diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Familial nonautoimmune hyperthyroidism due to TSHR G431S mutation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the identification of a heterozygous G to A transition in exon 10 at codon position 431, leading to the substitution of Gly431 with Ser, which resulted in constitutive activation of both the Gs/adenylyl cyclase and phospholipase C pathways, evident from functional characterization of the mutation.
